p: Attalea phalerata Mart. ex Spreng (Arecaceae) is a palm tree found in the central highlands of Bolivia, Brazil, Paraguay, and Peru [ 1], popularly known as the “bacuri,” and has economic importance as a source of vegetable oil [ 2]. This palm has bunches of fruit that have a fibrous, juicy pulp, a woody endocarp, and 2–4 hard nuts, which are mainly consumed fresh.
